nl.tudelft.simulation.jstats.charts.histogram

Class Histogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.simulation.jstats.charts.histogram.Histogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    nl.tudelft.simulation.jstats.Swingable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Histogram

    public class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements nl.tudelft.simulation.jstats.Swingable
    The histogram specifies a histogram chart for the DSOL framework.

    copyright (c) 2002-2018 Delft University of Technology , the Netherlands.
    See for project information www.simulation.tudelft.nl
    License of use: Lesser General Public License (LGPL) , no warranty.

    Since:
    1.5
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $ $Date: 2010/08/10 11:39:02 $
    Author:
    Alexander Verbraeck
    Peter Jacobs

                 double[] domain,
                 double[] range,
                 int numberofBins)
        constructs a new Histogram.
        Parameters:
        title - the title. The title of the histogram
        domain - the domain of the x-axis.
        range - the y-axis range of the histogram.
        numberofBins - the numberofbins of this histogram.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(nl.tudelft.simulation.jstats.statistics.Counter counter)
        adds a counter to the histogramdataset. This histogram then subscribes its dataset to the Counter.COUNT_EVENT.
        Parameters:
        counter - the counter to add.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String description,
                nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducerInterface source,
                nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventType eventType)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        adds an eventProducer to the histogram dataset. The histogram subscribes its dataset subsequentially to the specified event.
        Parameters:
        description - the description of the eventProducer
        source - the eventproducer which functions as source for this histogram.
        eventType - the eventType.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error for the (possibly remote) event listener

      • getDataset

        public HistogramDataset getDataset()
        returns the dataset of a histogram.
        Returns:
        the HistogramDataset containing all series.
